profile.text1: The Axa simulator takes into account different criteria to estimate your retirement.
profile.text2: The criteria « legal » but also projections that vary according to certain factors, such as the increase in the time of the cost of health or inflation or the evolution of wages.
profile.text3: Knowing the current age of your children allows us to know, for example, whether they will still be at your expense, as students, at the time of retirement.
profile.text4: Getting to know you better by also incorporating other personal criteria in our calculations leads us to better define your profile and to refine our simulation.

popup.title: title popup recap
popup.text: Knowing your budget today will enable us to estimate your savings capacity and to compare your standard of living today with that you will have after retiring.

error.message: Vos dépenses ne peuvent pas dépasser vos revenus. Merci d'ajouter vos revenus, ou de réduire vos dépenses.

popup.text:
The legal age of retirement depends on your year of birth. Within the framework of pension reforms, it will increase progressively from 60 to 67 years old.
If you were born in 19xx, you may retire at the age of 67 years old, as long as you have worked 172 terms.
You may also retire earlier, or later, which will change the amount of your pension once you have retired.

home.title: Housing
home.text: At the start of our career, we usually rent a small and inexpensive lodging. At the end of our career, even if we own property, the costs associated with housing remain quite high, (property tax, maintenance & renovations, replacement of furniture and appliances,...).

family.title: FAMILY
family.text: The cost of schooling for children increases with the level of studies, and can be expensive in the case of prolonged studies (e.g. private business or engineering schools…). Moreover, parents remain a long term financial support for a longer amount of time, in terms of either their children’s first big investments or for their grandchildren.

health.title: HEALTH
health.text: The older we get, the more our health costs tend to grow exponentially due to the increasing need for medicine, treatment and care.

hobby.title: HOBBY
hobby.text: Retirement gives people more time to make the most of life. Holidays, outings, visiting grandchildren,...This part of the budget often increases at retirement age.

other.title: OTHER
other.text: Le Lorem Ipsum est simplement du faux texte employé dans la composition et la mise en page avant impression. Le Lorem Ipsum est le faux texte standard de l'imprimerie depuis les années 1500, quand un peintre anonyme assembla ensemble des morceaux de texte pour réaliser un livre spécimen de polices de texte.

legend.var1: * Average annual salary = average of the best 25 years capped at 38 K €.
legend.var2: ** The rate varies from 25% to 50%. At 50%, it is called the " maximum rate ".
legend.var3: *** The contribution period is expressed quarterly. It is possible to validate up to 4 terms per year.

start.title:
Calculer ma retraite en ligne,
c’est simple et rapide !
start.title_cta: Pourquoi préparer sa retraite dès maintenant ?

bulb.title: Let’s take an example !
bulb.description:
Delphine is 34 years old.
She rents a property in Bordeaux.
She has two children, aged 5 and 8, and has full custody of them since her divorce

left.title: Her budget
left.description:
She is a Communications Manager with
an executive status and her monthly revenue is 2 500 €/mois.
She has no specific career plan.
left.description-2:
Apart from her children, Delphine has two passions in life:
paragliding, on which she spends around 500 euros a year,
and Milou, the family dog, who costs 60 euros a month.

left.description: Delphine will retire in 2049 at the age of 67. Her estimated salary at the end of her career will be 4 500 € but she will only have 2 700 € pension.
left.description-2:
Her shortfall will be 1 675 € hould she wish to maintain the standard of living she has today, once her children have left home.

By saving 330 330 € every month from now on, with a tax break of 345 € chaque année. a year, Delphine won’t need to make any difficult choices, as her standard leof living will be maintained.

right.title: Her expenses will be split as follows*:

exemple.disclaimer: * Based on information provided and salary, expenses and inflation forecasts.

explantion.title: Which criteria are taken into account for the simulation ?
explantion.headline:
Axa’s simulator takes different criteria into account in order
to estimate your pension.
explantion.text:
Some are " legal " criteria and some are forecasts that may vary
depending on various factors, such as the rise in health
care costs, inflation or salary evolution.
explantion.text1:
Integrating other, more personal, criteria into our calculations helps
us to better define your profile and refine your simulation.
explantion.text2:
Knowing the age of your children enables us, for example, to know
whether they will still be your dependents, as students, when you retire

explantion2.title: How is retirement age calculated ?
explantion2.subTitle: In order to benefit from the state pension funded by social security, you need have paid contributions over at least one term (and earned a monthly minimum of 1 452 €), towards the general social security scheme.
explantion2.text: The legal age for retirement is: 62.
explantion2.text1: The pension is calculated at the full level if the minimum number of terms is reached. If you were born in 1956, you need 166 terms terms to have the maximum pension. If you were born in 1973, you need 172 terms.
explantion2.text2: Surcharges, as well as increases, may apply. For example, each year worked over the age of 60 years gives rise to a premium of 5%
explantion2.text3:
The number of children you raised (whether your own, those of your spouse, or adopted children) will increase the number of terms:
8 quarters per child for those born up until 12/31/2009. For each child 12/31/2009, 4 quarters go automatically to the mother and the other 4 are to be allocated to the father, the mother, or both (to be decided in the year of the child’s fourth birthday).
explantion2.text4: Health insurance policies can also have a very important effect on retirement and getting the maximum rate.
explantion2.text5: There are in fact many special cases. Hence the importance of being well advised in order to obtain a precise estimate and optimize your retirement.
explantion2.text6: However, you can choose to continue working. The maximum rate is guaranteed for those working up to age 67.
explantion2.text7: Retirement lasts on average 28 years for women and 24 years for men.
